alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 4:38PM MDT until June 04 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Carbon County in south central Montana... Central Stillwater County in south central Montana... * Until 745 PM MDT. * At 438 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near and just south of Absarokee. Between 1.0 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in less than an hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding may be ongoing or begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Streams that may see flooding include Butcher Creek, East Rosebud Creek, Rosebud Creek and Beaver Creek. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Absarokee. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
